definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Lan/abbr. for Lanzhou 蘭州|兰州[Lan2 zhou1], Gansu
orchid (蘭花|兰花 Cymbidium goeringii)/fragrant thoroughwort (蘭草|兰草 Eupatorium fortunei)/lily magnolia (木蘭|木兰)

sentences.english: It is discussed the occurrence and harmfulness of valsa sordida of poplar in 4 aspects.
sentences.chinese: 从4个方面论述了杨树烂皮病的发生规律及危害性。

sentences.english: What a filthy behavior! Fucking person it is.
sentences.chinese: 真他妈肮脏的行为，烂人一个。

sentences.english: One corrupt apple corrupts many sound ones.
sentences.chinese: 一个烂苹果可以使许多好苹果烂掉。

sentences.english: The boy cheated his friend out of the apple by insisting that it was rotten.
sentences.chinese: 这男孩硬说苹果烂了，从他朋友处骗走了苹果。

sentences.english: The movie's exposition and plotting are mega-lame.
sentences.chinese: 那部电影的情节和故事阐述真是超级烂。

sentences.english: The woodwork of the window frames is perishing.
Ke-year-old Japanese Black Daobing see, the tears around the world All condensate.
sentences.chinese: 烂柯岁日刀兵见，方圆世界泪皆凝。

sentences.english: One bad apple spoiled the barrel.
sentences.chinese: 一个烂苹果，糟蹋一整箩。

sentences.english: The barrel of good apples stinks.
Children are always told to chew their food up well.
sentences.chinese: 人们总是教育孩子们要把食物嚼烂嚼细。

sentences.english: Lu Xun hoped that literary critics should do the job of "gouging rotten apples".
sentences.chinese: 鲁迅曾提出希望文艺批评家做“剜烂苹果”的工作。

sentences.english: See tomato rotten can put some chicken out of the pan.
sentences.chinese: 看番茄烂了就可以放些鸡精出锅。

sentences.english: Wash beef, pat dry and mince. Stir in seasonings gradually until well-mixed.
sentences.chinese: 牛肉洗净，印干，剁烂，慢慢拌入调味料至均匀。

definition: spectacle too horrible to endure (idiom); tragic sight/appalling scenes of devastation
to break down/to break into pieces/fragmentary
muddled and completely collapsing (idiom); in an awful condition/complete shambles/a total mess
to compare two unsatisfactory things/to argue that others have similar or worse faults (as a response to criticism)/whataboutery
to explode or burst/to quick fry or quick boil
